        This function is called when the unit is deleted. It should be over-ridden to clean up the unit (e.g. close open files).

      • process

        public abstract void process()
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        ************************************************************* *********** Programmers implement their code here *********** *************************************************************

        If a user wants to include an algorithm into Triana then this method must be implemented and the appropriate algorithm invoked here.

        This method should always be over-ridden, as if the unit does nothing DEADLOCK occurs!.

        Specified by:
        process in class Unit
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getInputNode

        public TrianaType getInputNode(int nodeNumber)
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the data at input node nodeNumber. If data is not ready, NOT_READY triana type is returned. If there is no cable connected to the input node the NOT_CONNECTED triana type is returned.
        Parameters:
        nodeNumber - the node you want to get the data from.

      • outputAtNode

        public void outputAtNode(int outputNode,
                TrianaType data)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets the data at output node outputNode. This method should be used to set the data at each particular output node (if this is necessary) This function would only be used in very few cases. The normal default function is to duplicate the data at all output nodes so hence one call to output() passing the data often suffices.
        Parameters:
        outputNode - the output node you wish to set
        data - the data to be sent

      • outputAtNodeNonBlocking

        public void outputAtNodeNonBlocking(int outputNode,
                           TrianaType data)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets the data at output node outputNode but this call does not block. Use isOutputSent to poll to find out if it has been delivered.
        Parameters:
        outputNode - the output node you wish to set
        data - the data to be sent
        See Also:
        boolean isOutputSent(int outputNode)

      • setOutputType

        public void setOutputType(java.lang.Class trianaType)
        Deprecated. 
        This method is used to change the type of data that is currently being output from this unit and tells the GUI to redraw its cable so that the new type of information can be seen by a different coloured cable leaving this unit.

      • setOutputType

        public void setOutputType(java.lang.String name)
        Deprecated. 
        This method is used to change the type of data that is currently being output from this unit and tells the GUI to redraw its cable so that the new type of information can be seen by a different coloured cable leaving this unit. Here give the full name of the type e.g. "triana.types.SampleSet"

      • setOptional

        public void setOptional(int index)
        A convienience method that sets the data input node at the specified index to optional. This means that the scheduler does not wait for data from the node before continuing with processing. By default input nodes are not set to optional (i.e. they are set to essential).

      • isOptional

        public boolean isOptional(int index)
        A convienience method that returns whether the data input node at the specified index is optional. If a node is optional this means that the scheduler does not wait for data from the node before continuing with processing. By default input nodes are not set to optional (i.e. they are set to essential).

      • setEssential

        public void setEssential(int index)
        A convienience method that sets the data input node at the specified index to essential. This means that the scheduler does must wait for data from the node before continuing with processing. By default input nodes are not set to essential (this is the opposite of optional).

      • isEssential

        public boolean isEssential(int index)
        A convienience method that returns whether the data input node at the specified index is essential. If a node is essential this means that the scheduler must not wait for data from the node before continuing with processing. By default input nodes are set to essential (this is the opposite of optional).

      • getPopUpDescription

        public java.lang.String getPopUpDescription()
        This returns a brief! description of what the unit does. The text here is shown in a pop up window when the user puts the mouse over the unit icon for more than a second.
        Overrides:
        getPopUpDescription in class Unit

      • getHelpFile

        public java.lang.String getHelpFile()
        Deprecated. now set as a parameter in Tool
        This function must be implemented for each Triana unit to specify the help file for this unit. We really must insist that people write help files in order to keep Triana as user-friendly as possible! Help files should be written in html format. If not, they will displayed in text format. You can simply enter the name of the unit (.html) and then Triana looks for this help file in several places e.g. :-

        1. in $GRIDHOME/doc/help and then within the tool and main subdirectories.
        2. in the users getApplicationDataDir directory within a directory called help and then within the tool and main subdirectories.
        3. Any path specified by the GRID_HELP environment variable and also then within the tool and main subdirectories.

          You can alternatively enter the location as an absolute path name or a network address e.g.

          "http:///www.astro.cf.ac.uk/pub/Ian.Taylor/Triana/Help/Wave.html"
          or
          "/usr/local/ian/Triana/Help/Wave.html"

          If you don't wan't to provide help (!!!) the this function should return the String "none" or null.

        Returns:
        the location of the help file for this unit.

      • parameterUpdate

        public void parameterUpdate(java.lang.String paramname,
                   java.lang.Object value)
        Called to update internal unit variables when the value of a parameter changes. Whether this is called immediately the parameter is updates, or just before the process method depends on the units param update policy.
        Overrides:
        parameterUpdate in class Unit

      • getName

        public static final java.lang.String getName(java.lang.String nameAndNumber)
        Deprecated. 
        Parameters:
        nameAndNumber - the name and the number in one string e.g. node1

      • getNumber

        public static final int getNumber(java.lang.String nameAndNumber)
        Deprecated. 
        Parameters:
        nameAndNumber - the name and the number in one string e.g. node1
        Returns:
        the value of the integer which is tagged along at the end of given name. Could do this yourself but this is a short cut. Useful when loading back lists of parametes e.g. node1, node2, node3 etc .....
